name: Theo's Little Bot
body:
# theobot # Hey! I'm a little bot belonging to [Theopolisme](//en.wikipedia.org/wiki/User:Theopolisme). You can **[read all about me at my Wikipedia userpage](//en.wikipedia.org/wiki/User:Theo's Little Bot)**. I do a *whole lotta stuff*, including, but certainly not limited to, file manipulation, WikiProject tagging, artificial intelligence article selection, citation expansion, link removal, and much, much more. ### Running Theo's Little Bot locally ### If for some reason my operator ever disappears, you can run me on your own computer (or server, I'm not picky). You *will* need to install a few things, though: > * [mwclient](http://sourceforge.net/projects/mwclient/) > * [mwparserfromhell](https://github.com/earwig/mwparserfromhell)* > * [requests](http://docs.python-requests.org/en/latest/)* > * [dateutil](http://labix.org/python-dateutil)** > * [PIL](http://www.pythonware.com/products/pil/)*** > * [BeautifulSoup](http://www.crummy.com/software/BeautifulSoup/)**** > _* only for some scripts_
> _** only for time-related scripts_
> _*** only for NonFreeImageResizer_
> _*** only for HTML scraping scripts_
After this, you just need to create the file `password.py` in the `theobot` subdirectory (don't worry, `.gitignore` in the main directory makes sure it isn't uploaded to github for the world to see), and include the following: # password.py username = "YOUR BOT USERNAME" password = "AND ITS PASSWORD" main_username = "YOUR USERNAME, FOR TESTING" main_password = "AND YOUR PASSWORD" githubuser = "YOUR GITHUB USERNAME" githubpassword = "AND PASSWORD" rottentomkey = "AN API KEY FOR ROTTEN TOMATOES" # see developer.rottentomatoes.com You'll then be ready to rumble!
note: Don't delete this file! It's used internally to help with page regeneration.
